metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4967 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple argument injection vulnerabilities in Ansible before 1.6.7 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging access to an Ansible managed host and providing a crafted fact, as demonstrated by a fact with (1) a trailing " src=" clause, (2) a trailing " temp=" clause, or (3) a trailing " validate=" clause accompanied by a shell command. It was discovered that Ansible mishandled certain input. A remote attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1
ansible-fireball - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1
ansible-node-fireball - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1').
